International football isn't working

After England's processional victory over San Marino on Friday, it's clear that World Cup qualification is in need of a major overhaul

Why is the scrum always gone?

Robert Culshaw reflects on how changes to the game in the last two decades have damaged the current state of rugby league

Just what football needs?

After University Chancellor Greg Dyke was announced as the next Chairman of the Football Association, Tom Fennelly asks if the former BBC Director General is the right man to govern English football

Heartbreak for York in futsal semi final

A memorable season for York's futsal team came to a close on Sunday, as they were defeated by the narrowest of margins in the BUCS Championships semi final

Six Nations 2013 Tournament Review

After Wales claimed Six Nations glory on Saturday, George Barrett looks back at the winners and losers from this year's tournament

Durham blow away women's hockey firsts

A comprehensive victory from start to finish was well-earned for Durham in the final round of BUCS fixtures this year on the JLD, in a game where York had little to play for

Women's badminton whitewash deflated Teesside

York's badminton ladies' firsts proved too strong for Teeside's firsts team, as the White Rose cruised a comprehensive victory in the Sports Centre

Durham prevail in women's lacrosse final

A gutsy performance from York women's first lacrosse team failed to stop Durham thirds from winning the BUCS Northern Conference Cup on Wednesday, despite a strong start

Women's rugby beaten by Northumbria

UYWRUFC played their final home match of the league yesterday against a very strong and determined Northumbria side, who have now been promoted to the Premier League

Men's lacrosse undone in cup final

The men's lacrosse team missed out on cup glory, after falling at the last hurdle in the BUCS Northern Conference Cup Final 10-5 against an efficient Liverpool team

Football seconds put Teeside to the sword with brilliant second half display

The men's football seconds came back from 2-1 down to convincingly beat Teeside 5-2 on a chilly 3G pitch to finish the term on a high with a sixth straight win

UYRUFC end promotion campaign with a win

The men's rugby firsts today completed their BUCS season in style, defeating Sheffield 36-14 to cap a year that has seen them win promotion to the Premier League

Spirited performances see improved display from Octopush Club in Nationals

An impressive performance in the Octopush British Student Nationals saw York's A team claim ninth place whilst the B team claimed 15th, a marked improvement on last year

In defence of footballers' wages

Andrew Knowles argues the case in favour of the massive pay packets enjoyed by the Premier League's top performers

College Cup 2013 Fixture List

The full fixture list for College Cup 2013, beginning in Week 3 with the Group Stage and including the Cup, Plate and Vase quarter and semi finals

James win college lacrosse tournament

Technical ability took a backseat on a blustery Sunday on 22 Acres, with James defeating Derwent 5-2 in the final to win the college lacrosse tournament

College Cup 2013 Draw

The draw for the 2013 College Cup was made this lunchtime, with holders Vanbrugh firsts drawn alongisde Derwent firsts in Group D

BUCS points on the board for men's water polo

An impressive performance in Sunday night's water polo semi finals saw the York men's team claim BUCS points for the first time in recent memory

Langwith dismantled in Hes East derby encounter

A 2-0 scoreline didn't do Goodricke justice as they demolished their Hes East rivals Langwith on 22 Acres this Sunday and finished their league campaign with a flourish

Sublime Derwent comeback fails to secure title

An inspired comeback by Derwent in the second half against Alcuin secured the win they needed to keep their hopes of winning the Spring league alive, despite trailing 2-1 at half-time

Wentworth thrash Vanbrugh to take college league title

Wentworth claimed their first ever college football league title today, after producing a 4-0 demolition of Vanbrugh on the 3G Pitch to cap a fine season

Men's lacrosse team stay unbeaten with emphatic Durham win

The men's lacrosse team produced a sensational second-half performance on Wednesday against a tough Durham side, once again proving their promotion credentials with a 16-8 victory

York's Equestrian team win final BUCS competition

On Wednesday, the York Equestrian First Team won their final BUCS Championship League competition, beating Bishop Burton, Durham and Teesside to the top spot

Fantastic York cruise past Sunderland

York's netball team brilliantly brushed aside their Sunderland opponents today in a comprehensive 44-32 victory. A solid team performance, underpinned by the exceptional Amy Moye gave the York side a very impressive win

Late Durham comeback forces hockey draw

Durham mustered a late comeback against the run of play after the men's hockey firsts dominated the majority of the game across the entire pitch of the JLD this afternoon

Draycott rescue act edges UYRUFC towards promotion

A dramatic late try from Hugh Draycott ensured a tense 31-25 win for the men's rugby firsts against Bishop Burton this afternoon, bringing York to the verge of promotion to the Premier League

Uncharted Waters

Tom Fennelly speaks to the Sailing and Windsurfing Club as a successful year sees them preparing for the national championships

Goodricke steal the show in blistering second half

A stunning second half from Goodricke gave them victory over Alcuin on a gloomy 3G pitch, despite only leading 1-0 at half-time and playing the entire game without a recognised goalkeeper

Star Power

After Will Greenwood and Austin Healey trained with the Rugby Club last week, George Barrett talks to the rugby legends and assesses the role that professional sportsmen can play at a grassroots level

Rugby seconds dismantled

A string of injuries disrupted the men's rugby seconds in a tough clash with an in-form Newcastle side as they fell 43-0 despite a spirited performance
